intro: Tragia angustifolia var. furialis, commonly known as the narrowleaf tragia, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with low rainfall and high temperatures. Tragia angustifolia var. furialis is often found growing in rocky soils and along dry riverbeds.
